== Headings ==
Note, the line must start and end with an equals sign <code>=</code>.  Even a single space at the end of the line will cause it not to work.
This: <pre>
= Header 1 = 
=== Header 2 ===
==== Header 3 ====
===== Header 4 =====
====== Header 5 ======
====== Header 6 ====== }}}

Produces:
== Header 1 ==
=== Header 2 ===
==== Header 3 ====
===== Header 4 =====
====== Header 5 ======
======= Header 6 =======

== Horizontal rule ==
Any line that starts with 4 or more dashes should produce a horizontal rule even if text follows so this:{{{
----
-----
------
-------
--------
Between two HRs
---- Text after pushed to next line}}}

Produces:
----
-----
------
-------
--------
Between two HRs
---- Text after pushed to next line

== Text formatting ==
This: <code>__underlined__</code> Produces: __underlined__

This: <code>''emphasized''</code> Produces: ''emphasized''

This: <code>'''strong'''</code> Produces: '''strong'''

This: <code>a^2^ + b^2^ = c^2^</code> Produces: a^2^ + b^2^ = c^2^

This: <code>H,,2,,O</code> Produces: H,,2,,O

Mixing like this: <code>'''''Mix''' at the beginning''</code> Produces: '''''Mix''' at the beginning''

Mixing like this: <code>'''''Mix'' in __the middle__ and the beginning'''</code> Produces: '''''Mix'' in __the middle__ and the beginning'''

Interleaved mixing like this: <code>'''Interleaved __mixing''' even works__</code> Produces: '''Interleaved __mixing''' even works__

Mixing inside superscript and subscript like this: <code>F^__super__^ A,,'''sub''',,</code> Doesn't work:  F^__super__^ A,,'''sub''',,

But mixing superscript and subscript inside others: <code>__F^super^__ '''A,,sub,,'''</code> Does: __F^super^__ '''A,,sub,,'''

== Lists and Definitions ==

This:
<pre>
** one bullet
*** nested to level 2
**** nested to level 3
***** nested to level 4
** second bullet
    1. nested numbered list (doesn't work)
    2. nested numbered list (doesn't work)
** third bullet
</pre>

Produces:
** one bullet
*** nested to level 2
**** nested to level 3
***** nested to level 4
** second bullet
    1. nested numbered list
    2. nested numbered list
** third bullet

This:
<pre>
  1. Top-level numbered list
  2. Top-level numbered list
*** nested bullet
*** nested bullet
  3. See if we keep the numbering here!
</pre>

Produces:
  1. Top-level numbered list
  2. Top-level numbered list
*** nested bullet
*** nested bullet
  3. See if we keep the numbering here!

This:
<pre>
  Term:: a definition
  Another Term:: another definition, but with ''markup''
  :: a definition without a term
</pre>

Produces:
  Term:: a definition
  Another Term:: another definition, but with ''markup''
  :: a definition without a term

But this:
<pre>
* First bullet without leading space(s)
1. Numbered list without leading space(s)
Term/Definition markup:: without leading space(s)
</pre>

Doesn't work without leading spaces:
* First bullet without leading space(s)
1. Numbered list without leading space(s)
Term/Definition markup:: without leading space(s)

== Inline code ==

Doing this: `<code>Inline with braces</code>` or this <code>`Inline with backticks`</code>  Produces this: <code>Inline with braces</code> and `Inline with backticks`.

Putting the braces on different lines runs the code bock the full width, so this:<pre>
The following should show up as a full block of inline code <three left braces>
c = sqrt(a*a + b*b)
<three right braces>}}}

Produces:

The following should show up as a full block of inline code {{{
c = sqrt(a*a + b*b)
</pre>

Note that I have to use <code><three left braces></code> in the code block above because I'm using the inline code block feature to create the example.

== Linking and graphics ==
In a Wiki page, you use [square brackets] to create links. When you save the page, the contents of the square bracketed text will have a small __?__ link next to it, which you click to create a new page with that name.  This is the primary way to create new pages in a wiki.

This:
<pre>
* http://www.cylab.cmu.edu/
* [http://www.cylab.cmu.edu/]
* [http://www.cylab.cmu.edu/ Carnegie Mellon CyLab]
* ftp://www.nowwhere.com/pub/docs
* mailto:no-one@nowhere.com
* Show graphic only
http://www.cylab.cmu.edu/images/sm_cylab_logo.jpg
* Show graphic and make it a link
[http://www.cylab.cmu.edu http://www.cylab.cmu.edu/images/sm_cylab_logo.jpg]
* [BestPractices] Link inside of this wiki (using wiki rename tool will update)
* [Best Practices] Even works when you add the spaces
* [http:../somewhere/ Relative Link within site but outside of this wiki]
</pre>

Produces:
* http://www.cylab.cmu.edu/
* <nowiki>[[http://www.cylab.cmu.edu/]]</nowiki>
* <nowiki>[[http://www.cylab.cmu.edu/|Carnegie Mellon CyLab]]</nowiki>
* ftp://www.nowwhere.com/pub/docs
* mailto:no-one@nowhere.com
* Show graphic only
{{http://www.cylab.cmu.edu/images/sm_cylab_logo.jpg}} 
* Show graphic and make it a link
<nowiki>[[http://www.cylab.cmu.edu|{{http://www.cylab.cmu.edu/images/sm_cylab_logo.jpg}}]]</nowiki> 
* [BestPractices] Link inside of this wiki (using wiki rename tool will update)
* [Best Practices] Even works when you add the spaces
* <nowiki>[[http:../somewhere/|Relative Link within site but outside of this wiki]]</nowiki>
